Key Match Events: Slovakia scored the opening goal in the seventh minute.
Romelu Lukaku's first goal was disallowed due to offside.
Lukaku's second goal was disallowed due to a handball by Loïs Openda before his decisive pass.
Pre-Game Insights: Belgium was ranked No. 3 in FIFA men's world rankings, while Slovakia was ranked No. 48.
Belgium was the heavy favorite at -210, while Slovakia was +600 to win outright before the match started.
Post-Match Reflections: Belgium fell to a first loss in 15 games under coach Domenico Tedesco.
Slovakia has more than one day to prepare for facing Ukraine in Duesseldorf on Friday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dávid Hancko's brave goal-line block left him sprawled in the goal net with a face injury inflicted by a teammate's knee.
Belgium faces Romania in the Saturday evening game in Cologne.
The Associated Press contributed to this report.
